intro: Galinsoga subdiscoidea, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to the Americas and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and thrives in moist, open environments. It has a prostrate growth habit and produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Galinsoga subdiscoidea is often considered a weed but has ecological significance in supporting pollinators.
